metadata.title: CVE-2020-12390 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Incorrect origin serialization of URLs with IPv6 addresses could lead toincorrect security checks. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 76.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12390` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 76.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 76.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 76.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '76.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
